9aCT6ePI1Uy4LQFcEmuuww.text: This weekend was my first time going to Bahama Breeze with two of my friends and I'm sad I haven't tried this place sooner! Everything was great, I tried the "Zombie" drink which was nice and tropical. They have a nice selection of appetizers and my grilled chicken salad that was made with fresh fruit was fabulous! The server was very nice and attentive. I was also a fan of the fact the menu had the calorie information beside each item, it helped me make smarter choices in selecting my meal, I think all restaurants should start doing that. Lastly, I would like to say I enjoyed the island vibe that the entire restaurant had.

b-6tbmxRj-S35DnAbe5j8w.text: I luv the drink selection, always taste yummy on any day of the week!

HKdmOTX0_A_jWQL2Mey1lQ.text: Every once in a while I get a craving for jerk chicken pasta, which leads me right back to Bahama Breeze, so I was pleased when my group decided to go there last night.  I've never been disappointed with that dish, so it's my go-to, but I've also had the Cuban sandwich, the tilapia entree, the habanero wings, the goat cheese appetizer and these haven't disappointed me either.  I can't say that Bahama Breeze is absolutely amazing, which is why it won't get 5 stars from me, but for a chain restaurant I am impressed with the consistent quality and service that I receive there.  If you are in Robinson and craving some island fare head to Bahama Breeze and you should not be disappointed.  Oh, I almost forgot, and this may be unique to the Bahama Breeze in Robinson, but any time I've gone they have a live musician playing  Caribbean style music, which adds to the background quite nicely.

b8yPmFy9PftktikC2i9u1g.text: Love the environment ! Reminds me of islands in California, except much larger with high ceiling and open space.

yYet5c669oOX7iuYn7xCEw.text: We just gave this restaurant a second chance this evening.  It had been about three years since our last experience, be ause the food was mediocre at best and the service was poor.   We hoped for a better experience and received what we hoped for.....but just barely. The food was still mediocre. The service was slightly better. They had pleasant entertainment.  However, and sadly, it was not enough to bring us back again.  Shame.  I did so like the outdoor dining porch.

K9nigo8LDui3BvAfJkgS0w.text: This place is amazing check it out! The servers are friendly and the food is great. I recommend the jerk pasta. When I arrived I was sat quickly and met by my server in no time. This is a great place to start or end a evening of fun. Ps... ask for Travis, Anthony or Quinton they are just wonderful!

5aSwwZh2t6UJFWf2sQVwEA.text: This place was excellent.  Food was very good.  My wife ordered the Frozen Bahamarita and is was good.  Will be returning!

I7DtRwTto_YzfQb_kh8P_Q.text: This was my first visit to Bahama Breeze and I didn't know what to expect. We went on a Saturday night and the place was packed. Believe it or not, they had a 1 hour wait. But that's okay, we managed to find an empty chair in the huge foyer. Turns out that they have the best Pina Coladas ever. I had a Ultimate Pina Colada - swirled with strawberry ice and topped with Myers's Dark Rum and BJ had a couple Red Stripe beers. Yum. The wait time flew by, thanks in part to the island atmosphere and the live island music.   The host staff was great. When we were finally seated, we got a huge booth. Our server was pretty sad. I'm not sure what industry she should work in, but definitely not in the service industry. But we managed to get thru okay.   We shared a new appetizer on the menu. We got a Crab, Shrimp, Mango and Avocado Stack. It was a little stack of jumbo lump crabmeat, chilled shrimp, fresh avocados and apple-mango salsa layered and stacked; with a spicy honey-red pepper drizzle served on some frisee lettuce. The drizzle was very hot and the seafood was incredibly fresh. We loved it!   For dinner, Jim had Calypso Shrimp Linguine. It was spicy shrimp sauteed with garlic, scallions, creole spices and a touch of cream. The portion was huge and very delicious. I had the Jamaican Grilled Chicken Breast with mango glaze, served with fresh mango pineapple salsa, cinnamon mashed sweet potatoes and green beans. Very good.   For dessert, we shared a Chocolate Island. It was a chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie in a milk chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise with vanilla ice cream. Very yummy.   We loved the restaurant and can't wait to visit again!

6TURhzZ6PBxSkmzQe2AvKA.text: Jordan and I were once big fans of Bahama Breeze.  Their menu was always unique and does offer some healthier options.  Since we live in ShadySide, anytime we found ourselves out in Robinson, we had always made it a point to make a stop.  Our most recent visit, we have both agreed, was our very last.   If you have read my reviews, you may know that I do not like to give bad reviews based on just server performance.  However, it was the ENTIRE EXPERIENCE that has inspired us to give up Corporate Chains like Bahama Breeze completely. We went on rainy Labor Day Monday.  Since I was once a server, whether it's nice our or whether it's crappy out, Labor Day is ALWAYS busy.  People are off and don't want to cook - plain and simple.  Apparently their manager just got hired yesterday because they were extremely under-staffed, and the energy of the place showed it.  First of all, the hostess that greeted us was visibly irritated that people kept flowing through the door; but quoted us a 20 minute wait.  We waited for 60. Still, being understanding and patient, we let the mis-quoted wait time slide, even though other patrons were getting more visibly irritated at this fact.   When we were finally seated, we were seated at a table that faced the open kitchen.  I don't care where we sit - I really don't.  I always appreciated the Open Kitchen at Bahama Breeze; therefore, servers and line cooks couldn't engage in "bad habits" or bad food practices.  NOT SO ON THIS OCCASION!   We watched plates being stacked on top of other plates in the window (WHAT?!?!  SERIOUSLY!?!?  I would have been fired from 5 restaurants if I would have done that); we watched servers eating french fries and shrimp right off of people's plates on the line (which I have seen people get fired for!).  Then, after watching servers eat off the plates, they would touch their faces, and then grab the plates to take them to the tables. While waiting for our server, I hate to sound snobby, but every single server looked like they hadn't showered in a week; therefore, whomever was going to serve us, I was going to be grossed out by their lacking appearance.  Every single server, contrary to the frantic kitchen, was a slow-paced tortoise not giving a crap about the food piling up in the windows, the Expo yelling for food runners, and some guests still not having CLEAN silverware.  Every single server, male or female, was very un-kept, all had hair in their faces, and chewed food in front of their tables.  Eww.  Eww.  Eww.  When our server finally did greet us - OMG she was way over-perky.  Annoyingly perky, scripted, and high-pitched.  When she finally took our food and drink order, our waters came right away; however, it took a few minutes for Jordan to get his beer. *(Oh - and did I forget to mention that even during the long wait - that there were still about 20 open tables and 6 servers standing around?*) Then the wait for the food.  Jordan and I (who actually met working together as line cooks, 4 years ago) just watched the kitchen drown frantically.  Then I watched the Manager jump on the line - and that's when I knew it was all over from there.  When ANY Front of House manager jumps on the back of the line - just watch out.  Your food is going to SUCK!  Especially when every ticket that comes in, the Manager rolls his eyes.  Um...that is your job isn't it?  To make food and serve it to guests.  If you're rolling eyes dude...then PLEASE do the guests at Bahama Breeze a huge favor and leave and find a different calling. Also - if Bahama Breeze is going to rock the Open Kitchen in the first place - that kitchen better ALWAYS run a tight ship.  Plus - the windows through that open kitchen should at least look they were washed in the morning.  Not caked on grease that hadn't been touched in a week!!!  Does anyone do sidework there?  The mistakes that we saw MAY NOT been so bad, or disgusting, had we not seen them.  But since everything was in plain sight, it made it that much worse, and hard to swallow when we did finally get our food (literally). We saw our plates get put on the line.  And then we saw them sit for 20 minutes.  Without even an extensive knowledge of the menu, Jordan and I probably could have taught their kitchen a lesson or two.  We just watched our food sit there while the Expo and multiple servers just walked pass.  Not their table, not their problem, right?   As we watched our food just sit in the window, our server came over to us and asked "So how is everything going?".  Ummm...we really didn't know how to respond - did she really not see we had nothing in front of us besides two waters and one bottle of beer?  I said, "Oh the water is delicious.  Where is our food?" Finally a different server ran out our food and informed us that the plates were "really hot."  Yeah I know - I saw them sit in a heat lamp for 20 minutes.   Food tasted dry...like it had been under a heat lamp for 20 minutes. Need I say more?

PXo7EHTMiLfDf1F8Ph683Q.text: Michael M. Is an hourly manager here and has worked for Darden for years.  He is an awesome addition to the Bahama Breeze and will hopefully help it to improve.  Jeno was a good bartender and both of them made sure everything from drinks to appetizers to dinner was superb.  Food quality could be a little better but the appetizers -especially when they are half off during happy hour are worth a try.

zk-mEIZWb7uIslyMp4oyUQ.text: My husband and I go here often because the food is always delicious.  I'm sad they took my favorite dish off the menu.

JC5rT8yeAVsjXU7ADO4LpQ.text: Great Caribbean food. Loved their rice chicken bowl. However, I didn't like thier Mango Jalapeno Mojito. I find it too spicy.

J3zFkEyhPHWtLTKpGUkxjg.text: I will admit that General Mills did a good thing by spinning off its restaurants into Darden Restaurants in the mid 1990's quality and innovativeness has gone up across the board. So I was expecting good things from a chain restaurant.  The chain creates is one of the nicest casual dining ambiances that I have been into lately. The Beech house concept with wrap around porch, live music, fire pits, etc was beautifully done.   The biggest complaint I had was their Mojito - having lived in Florida for several years I have had many Mojito's and there's was not very good. First of all they get compliments for using spearmint - too many bars use mint, but spearmint is much closer to yerba Buena that is used in Cuba. A True mojito is actually complex drink with sweetness, a slight sourness, and mint. There's was a shallow one-dimensional drink with very little mint. It also appeared that the mine was simply placed in the glass, I could see no crushing (muddling) of the leaves that release the oils for flavor.  The Cuban black bean soup was very good albeit just slightly on the salty side and the West Indies Beef patties were excellent.  I had the Jamiccan grilled chicken breast for my entree, it was suppose to have jerk seasoning on it but I couldn't taste any. The picture on the website shows 2 chicken breasts and yet my plate only had one on it. The cook who grilled did a very nice job, perfect marks and it was done perfectly, not overcooked one bit. The pineapple mango salsa was pretty  plain and needs some work. Green beans were cooked nicely but greasy. And I really enjoyed the cinnamon mashed sweet potatoes.  For a chain the food was pretty good, however very pricy imho. Would I go back, yes, for convenience, different style of food and the atmosphere.

9R6KTxi9ptNMooR2rn2WlQ.text: Nice atmosphere. I sat at the bar and had the shrimp and lobster quesadillas. They were excellent but the service at the bar was a little slow. If you like amber beers try their brand I thought it was pretty good.

12d1GF4yqEp53ObI5bJvyA.text: We love the appetizers (especially the Mahi-Mahi stack) and all of the great dishes and beverages that we've gotten there. Great atmosphere, too! We love this place so much that my husband and I have picked this restaurant to celebrate my birthday tomorrow!

pLb9_VN1mzmq0QzoQLLRvw.text: Good food, hoppin' atmosphere. Good tropical drinks.  Service a little slow.

Lxmds0IE6CUiRKQkvCs3QA.text: I feel like they're trying very hard to have some sort of authentic cuisine but I'm not sure what they're going for. My wife got the jerk pasta which was decent. A little bland maybe. I had the Cuban sandwich I feel was served exactly how they intended, it just wasn't as good as hoped it would be. I got the black beans and rice as the side and it just seemed as though they were trying too hard to make them authentic and they fell short. The service was very fast and efficient and everyone was friendly. Really no problems to speak of just not my cup of tea.

KBNugzWLMq0EobnOjsxQxw.text: I generally don't like any kind of chain restaurant, so I walked into BB preparing to absolutely hate it.  (We were invited there by friends.)  I will say upfront that if, by some chance, we were in the Robinson Mall area and wanted something to eat, we would probably consider visiting BB again.    We started off with a terrific server - Mike - but he had to leave in the middle of the meal.  He was attentive, warm and friendly.  He made some good recommendations (the marinated wings and goat cheese appetizers) and answered all of our questions patiently and fully.  Unfortunate, the server who replaced him - Sue - apparently thought our table of five wasn't worth the effort. if we needed anything, we had to flag her down - almost grab her - as she breezed past our table.   As I said, the wings and goat cheese/bread rounds were very good.    My wife had a fruit/chicken salad that was light, very flavorful and well-portioned.  I, on the other hand, ordered the coconut shrimp dinner and a caesar salad.  The salad was limp and tasteless.  The shrimp  coating was more bread than coconut, and the shrimp themselves were rubbery in both texture and taste.  The red rice was cold.  Chilled, almost.  The broccoli, however, was very warm but that's because it was cooked to death.  Limp as pasta; it almost fell apart in a pile of green mush when I moved it with a fork.  (Why do places overcook vegetables like this?)  So, as I said, we might stop back but only for appetizers.

RcOmxVWBseSrEPk1_vsZXQ.text: I can't in good conscience give this place any stars at this point. We have been going to Bahama Breeze for about two years now. Until lately we have always received good, prompt service. We like to sit at the bar and the bartenders have always taken good care of us. There have been many changes in bartenders the last few months and none for the better. The last two times we have been there the service has been extremely slow. Last night we sat at the bar for twenty five minutes and finally walked out and went to Red Lobster next door. The bar was not that crowded and there were two girls behind the bar. They never even acknowledged we were there. I really doubt we will be back after that experience. The food is great at Bahama Breeze but until they get some decent help, they are going to be in trouble.

rVDvw_lFP0NVwl2OEawznA.text: Amazing service. We were greeted and spoken to by every employee we saw: the hostess, the busser, the servers, the food runner. Everyone was super nice and friendly. Honestly, some of the best customer service I've received in a restaurant ever.  The jerk chicken wings are tasty...unfortunately its not spicy whatsoever. They really need to kick up the heat on them.   On two occasions, we got the Cuban Sandwich. Its large with plenty of meat. The second time we got it, the sandwich had lettuce and tomatoes on it, which we didn't like. But its really a good sandwich.  Get the Breeze salad. It has a delicious dressing...salty, sweet and sour all in one. The real star, though, is the pumpkin seeds.  The rice and beans are good, though on both occasions, they were not hot when they got to the table, just warm.  We also got the tostones, which are fried plantains with a topping. These were not too good. There's not enough topping for all of the tostones and they're dry. There's no dipping sauce or anything, either. They were kind of bland.  The price is a little higher  than average but its manageable as long as you stay away from  the pricier items.

D8X3rRbe1BjED1-GqgoU6Q.text: This place is great for when you want passable food and delicious, sugary cocktails.  It is always packed, but they take open table reservations which is good.  I had the mahi mahi and it was completely unremarkable.  It wasn't bad, the stand out was the pineapple salsa that came on top of it, but the best part of dinner was my pineapple coconut martini.  It was delicious.  My friend and the cobb salad and it also looked okay.  Everything about Bahama Breeze is okay, but it's just okay.  There are obviously many better options in Robinson, but this is not the worst option.  It's just...okay!

foN1o9QQ_8QnINKcacsStw.text: Very slow service tonight. Not even busy. Took at least ten minutes to be greeted by server. $22 steak somewhat gristly. Had to wait for a steak knife that should have been brought to the table before the steak arrived. Server seemed uninterested. Asparagus extremely small and hard. Only the yellow rice was any good. Not too much to be excited about.

aQTToaZgNS70HgcmIf4p2g.text: Came in after my soccer game for a late night dinner. I ordered a water and ginger ale to drink... And BOTH beverages had mysterious items floating in it (yuck)! It looked like pulp from lemons or lines... Our server changed the beverages out, but it still looked like something extra was floating in the cups so I opted not to drink anything.  We also had to pay our tab right as we got our food. Slightly annoying but I can dig it. I ordered the Jamaican jerk chicken. It's actually pretty good and flavored/seasoned quite well. Their plantains are good as well.   Not sure what was up with the beverage situation but I'd likely come back in 4-6 months.

ME1TCuELVuOZH8p9hY6yHQ.text: I have to say that this is a really beautiful location. We recently had a company dinner here. We are a large group. My group was able to sit at a large, fun, circular table with a fit pit in the middle. It was too hot for a fire, but we enjoyed the inclusive nature of our seating that allowed for group conversation and laughter. Our group had chosen a fixed menu (chicken or fish) that was able to appeal to everyone in attendance. Veggies offered were fresh and full of taste. I am only giving three stars because I would like to say that the staff did their best to accommodate our large group - but they fell a little short by serving everyone in our group except about five people. Those five were forgotten to the point that the staff approached and asked if we were ready for boxes while our settings were clear and we were awkwardly sitting there. We had to specifically ask to be served food (despite being served drinks all night). Large groups are tough to serve, but having experienced and aware staff on hand would really make a huge difference in these settings. Luckily, their strawberry margarita was ON POINT.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry Margarita!

T8ToL3IP74ka01xwsTaIkg.text: Went here once. Was so excited because they have a beautiful patio, and a really fun atmosphere! the feel and ambiance, 10/10! however everything else is quite sub-par. The drinks, over-priced, which I expected, but the drinks themselves were not good. I got some fruity drink in a coconut (love that part!) but it was too sweet. The bartender did not know what she was doing when she made this, I could barely drink it! I am honestly not very picky when there's alcohol involved, but this was unfortunate.   The food was absolutely terrible though! Everything was frozen- I got grilled chicken and it was so rubbery! The appetizers came straight from a bag in the freezer. So as logn as your okay with a bunch of low-quality frozen food, then you'll be fine. But because the food and drinks were so sub-par, I can't see myself visiting them again, which I'm actually quite bummed about because I LOVED the music and atmosphere.

Vg5l-uS5n4zXMCwt45szaQ.text: I don't often frequent this place but now and then I will give it a try. Today's visit we had a very pleasant and helpful waitress. There is free Wi Fi here in the event you need it which is always a plus for me.  My girlfriend and I both decided to have one of the seafood specials of the day. We each had wood grilled tilapia covered with almonds along with a side of sweetened mashed potatoes and broccoli. Since we got there shortly after it opened it wasn't crowded but sure got crowded by the time we left.  The food was good and for a luncheon the prices were reasonable.It is not one of my better seafood entrees but passable. There is an extensive menu and they do have during the week lunch specials which you can choose an entree with either a soup or a salad.  They do have a bar area which we didn't take advantage of.  The restaurant sits off the road near the mall of Robinson where there are other restaurants in that same off shoot. So parking can sometimes be a problem.  Please note that this restaurant is a "chain" so you will find it in other cities as well.

gb_Tbl8bahz_2NPKmZffYQ.text: We have always loved Bahama Breeze, and considered it a special night out!  NO LONGER!   We were a party of 6 seated outdoors and there were 2 large parties inside, but to WaIT 3 HOURS for food after ordering is unheard of!   What was supposed to be a nice birthday dinner was ruined!   2 tables of 4 ( we were 6) nearby came in after us, were served and left before our order arrived.   The Mahi bowl I ordered- 3 hours later was a soupy tasteless bowl of coconut milk!   The half off discount hardly made up for what was a sad excuse of service all around.   This location will not be visited by the 3 families in our party.  Very sad to say- but it all falls on poor management.

ZX_2E5qh9lsbvi1jXMP5WQ.text: I love Bahama breeze. Anytime I'm in a city where there's a Bahama breeze, I go. I've always had great experiences at the locations I've visited, but that ended tonight. The 6100 Robinson Center Dr in Pittsburgh is the absolute worst location I've ever been to. I was disappointed in the flavor lapse in the food, the service was subpar, and the manager rushed us out into the cold with 48mins left until closing. No wonder this is the emptiest location I've ever seen. It's awful.

UP2rs_dD-Z0gZgZCKPyzkQ.text: We came for the outdoor music and drinks. Well, the music was great!! The reggae made you feel like you were on vacation!! The drinks were good, but not as pictured on the menu! The cactus juice schnapps wasn't even filled to the top????I felt like I was cheated out of what I paid for. The tiered layers on the frozen drink seemed like it was just mixed in. Disappointed with the drinks. I can't comment on the food,  but will give it another go maybe the bartender might have had an off night. If your looking for outdoor music this would be a good place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is what the drink is supposed to look like!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is the disappointing drink I was served! Cactus juice on side not filled to top and tiered frozen layers just thrown in!! BOO!!!

el3p9MD6SguMi14H5VX6rA.text: I really enjoyed the food and drinks here and the service was fast.  I ordered the firecracker shrimp and would suggest that to anyone.

_T9uJ3I7ROyvWNRQkLAZMQ.text: Just had a great experience here! Sat at the bar before heading out on a flight back west. Anthony was tending bar and made my mojito to perfection, after I asked for some minor specifics. He also recommended a great appetizer that hit the spot.   Would give 5 stars, but I usually hesitate if I have only had one visit. I will be back (might be awhile as I live In California) and will update on my second trip!   Try the jerk shrimp....yum.

bjzXz_ciSfP9ISAFnlSxog.text: Awesome happy hour! Half priced apps and good deals on drinks. The firecracker shrimp app is delicious, and the service is always good.  The GM, Victoria, is the bomb!!! ;)

TAEI-rL5qlMkjUWxxedb9w.text: This restaurant is completely disgusting the food is horrible. I have nothing good to say except the server  I believe her name was Mariah was great and handle herself very well. Other than that I doubt that I would ever go back!

4_l5hY34y5X4B-wU7LJ7pg.text: I love this restaurant!  It has a good menu, different from other Pgh menus.  We go here often, and I usually get the Cobb salad, its great.  On Tuesday I tried the coconut shrimp tacos, they were so good!  The spicy shrimp appetizer is my favorite.  The restaurant is pretty, we have always had good servers. If you have to wait they have a lovely waiting area, it is just always an enjoyable experience to dine here.

5MT0UyT8Aow7xkfWijoS6g.text: If Gilligan's Island had furniture, cushions, umbrella drinks, and served food, they may just call it Bahama Breeze.  I am not a big fan of chain restaurants - I am a "buy local" type of guy but the food was really well done.  I purchased the firecracker shrimp and a salad (with fruit, grilled chicken, etc.. - I forget the name but it really was because of the bliss due to the mixture of chicken, cheese, fruit, dressing, etc...)  Atmosphere - at first I was worried that i walked in to a Red Hat Society meeting because the median age was 62 years old but quickly realized the folks there just know good food.    It was great  Price - the appetizers are $5-12 depending on what you get.   The entree My salad had a crazy price - $10.69 - I am not sure why it was $10.69 - I made sure to add $0.31 to the tip just so I could continue my rounding.   The prices were good but they did try to increase my math difficutly.  Food - The firecracker shrimp was just a tad over cooked but still had explosive flavor.   The salad rocked and I was able to save my calories that evening for some high octane beer in Sewickly.  I will definitely go there again.   If you have not been you are just missing out ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad was very good!

cREqzFBWRBm5pF5djdGzWA.text: Ahi stack looked like raw pink blobs on a plate and completely not appetizing. Within 2 minutes of getting appetizer the main dish was brought to table. Despite being piping hot, the shrimp in my bowl were nearly transparent and not well cooked at all. Manager tried to do right by us but not the first disappointing experience here . Will think long and hard before returning. Quality has taken a tumble over the years.

LY8awG6d9QpD6WFhiXj7KQ.text: Visitor in the Pittsburgh area. Dinner was tremendous and our server did an excellent job. We were fortunate to get outside seating so we were able to enjoy the live music.

MW_NmD15lRfcgPqiqEXj7Q.text: I have never had a bad experience here! Every time everyone is so sweet and attentive. Not to mention the atmosphere- such a great get away from the suburbs I truly feel like I'm in the Florida keys when I am inside this restaurant. I usually get the "coconut shrimp" BUT I substitute it to be firecracker.... they offer the firecracker as the appetizer but let me switch it out to have a full "meal"'with bigger portions and with the sides as well. That's one thing I really want to stress... this restaurant is happy to make simple accommodations that other restaurants may be agitated to do.   Great drinks, appetizers, and entrees. The sizes are good and the prices are pretty average considering the location, portions, and type of food of course. I would compare this to a more tropical Red Lobster if you will. Defiantly give it a try!!

s6W13hv484Euvcfx6KSliQ.text: It's okay.  Nothing to write home about.  My classic house margarita tastes like orange juice (and I'm not talking Triple sec).  Kinda odd.  Cool atmosphere though.

L71fozF9O3FZFKEjKvMqFw.text: Service here used to be good. Now the service is just o.k. Food is par, neither great nor poor. Restrooms filthy. No manager interaction, just walking around. Probably won't be back.

yCxkX6Ydh5w9N27XRZi9tg.text: Do not come here with a group. Their waiter takes a looong time to place and bring drink orders. The waiter then takes your order and come back after 10-15 minutes to say that they don't have the item you ordered anymore. They ran out literally a minute ago. Then you order something different and are told that they also are out of THAT item.  Each item was labeled as a "signature dish". How do you run out of something labeled as such and not inform guests before they order.   Upsetting place. Tons and tons of other restaurant options around it to consider.

js1MXWax-XwEa75Mdd1Z4g.text: Not usually a fan of chain restaurants but my fiancee claims their buttermilk chicken is to die for so we stopped after bridesmaids dress shopping. Highly impressed, seated right away. Our server, I'm upset I forget her name (20s maybe early 30s, blonde) was amazing and friendly. Gave good recommendations and was courteous. Food was all tasty. Drinks were fantastic. Pricing was appropriate for the food we got. I would definitely come again if in that part of town, and like I said I hate chain restaurants.

PVqNEWPbq5s1hGvm4DiiEg.text: Not the best service. Food tasted good. Don't come when  it's busy. It was a Saturday night and the staff was nice but something is going wrong in the kitchen.

Mr7cAZg_32ZtKjgZV7wNog.text: Most tables sit only 4. In a bit too busy Friday night, still took about 30 mins to seat 5 of us. Had the menu to look thru before hand and ordered immediately. They were out of my first choice in entree so tried something else. The bowls are so surprisingly yummy! Love the mix of spices and the chipotle one has veggies and a kick. The plantain one was the right mix of spices and sweetness. Such a party in your mouth! Would definitely come back for the bowls.

SJySIRwkkNe0RUOaxQXenw.text: For a chain, this place ain't half bad. It's a great hangout specially if you get a table outside in summers.  Cocktails are the real deal here. My favorite would be Zombie and Mango Mojito. There are few other colorful options so every visit can be a new experience. No point if you play safe here.  Not a big fan of main course but appetizers are great. Having been to Jamaica, I can say that the jerk chicken here comes close to the actual authentic version. Coconut shrimps are good too. As for the main course, I always go with West Indies Chicken rice bowl. It has a mixed Caribbean and Indian flavor which appeals to me.  Make sure you get a seat outside, possibly facing the Robinson mall. That alone will add to the pleasure in a warm evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana split ... Yum!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The jumbo Island Hopper with onion rings, coconut shrimp and jerk chicken.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut shrimp

m2Jo-P5q85VN0z68Q5OZXw.text: This has always been a family favorite  for years . But last two times we have been disappointed  not so much with the food but the service  When we are out to eat I don't want to listen  to the waitress complain about who left the dishes there and would  like  to see her once in a while. At our table And they should train their people  not to hand a hot plate to anyone  especially  a child

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qcvwkJ-ojEjiEFy6mkXGlg.text: Their smothered pork goodness is to die for. I loved the crispiness of the pork coupled with the awesome fried yuka balls with cheese inside smothered by guava sauce. My husband ordered the Cuban sandwich which is just ok. Their Cubano Mojito is also good, refreshing and has a good alcohol in it.   The only reason I gave this a 4 stars is because the server is not too friendly. I feel that hospitality has to be good for this place to get a 5 star.   I'll recommend this place and will surely comeback.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smothered Pork Goodness

ImvW68qd6O_fXnsLkDp6KQ.text: Not that enjoyable. Got the shrimp that were knock off bang bang shrimp and it wasn't that good because the shrimp were hard underneath the flour it was fried in. The chicken was supposed to be jerk and it didn't have enough jerk. Drink was awesome tho

XTjRgTeMzlxOWkPiitpxXQ.text: This place is not worth going to.  The last time I was there I got food poisoning.  I had ordered their steak with crab on top.   I later talked to someone who used to work there and he stated that the crab comes out of a can and was probably rancid.

a52I_vcHTKXHZ2qZ9RR_QQ.text: Service was ridiculously slow. It was a Sunday at like 1:30 and they were not that busy. They didn't have the ahi tuna salad I wanted but server didn't know until after I ordered and she left to put the orders in.  She returned later to inform me then I had to look at the menu all over again. So I ended up not getting to eat what I wanted. Likely will not return to this location.

MA2xoucWlkFMe2a-HG9nYA.text: It's like a trip to the Bahamas but a lot cheaper and quicker. Our favorite restaurant in greater Pittsburgh

lMSRA2TW7HLQbX_q4-8v2g.text: i kno this is a chain, but it's the only location around here and i've been nothing but satisfied every time i visit, the food is delicious, the prices are fair enough, the portions are large, and cocktails are so freakin good

wsKsAuA7YPZtxsdSVTCvGA.text: Decided to have dinner at Bahama Breeze at the suggestion of a good friend who's a regular. I was pleased to open the menu and find so many healthy options. The calories are listed with each menu item which is so awesome for us calorie counters!  I'm back to eating healthy and working out on a regular basis. I can definitely see myself having another healthy dinner here again especially after a good work out. This would also be a great place to grab a drink and to eat on your day off from counting calories.  I'd recommend trying the chicken tortilla soup(110 calories) and the grilled chicken and fresh fruit salad(660 calories).

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled chicken and fresh fruit on mixed greens. Juicy chicken breast with allot of fruit. Bring your appetite!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken tortilla soup. Very delicious! Plenty of chicken, avocado and tortilla strips.

xZUJ5itNwlODLfQY9Gfy0g.text: We order the lobster and shrimp quesadillas appetizer, lobster Mac and cheese and salmon. The food is pretty good, except that there's no much shrimp inside the quesadillas, we feel like we are just eating butter bread. Service is good. The black napkin is dirty, I'm surprised that they would give that to customers. The first two gin tonic we got at the bar are good, the third one we got at the table are mainly just tonic water. Overall, it's a good dining experience.

05Qyle9w0VKdD0T5drokFw.text: Thank you EARL.... we went out for a 6 person work dinner/drinks and he killed it with service. Theres not a lot of wait staff in the area thats good. We loved him!!!! He also seperated our checks and we didnt have to wait to long for our drinks!!!

-3K5YAQQI2rsL9QMHxk2QQ.text: We had not eaten at Bahama Breeze in many years. It was a hot summer night and anything with the word Breeze in it sounded good.  We started with two rum flights. We ordered two different kinds so we could try more kinds of drinks. I thought I liked rum but that doesn't seem to be the cases. LOL. The drinks were all tasty and they all tasted differently. It was fun to try them all.  For dinner I had Shrimp & Grits. Oh My Goodness was it good!  There were a lot of shrimp, the green beans were delicious, but WOW did I like the grits!!!  They were creamy but still had texture to them. There was bacon that gave the dish a touch of saltiness, but not too salty. It also came with mushrooms but I'm not fungi friendly so I asked to leave them off. It was a great dish and I had a happy tummy.  My husband had the Seafood Paella. It was loaded with seafood such as mussels, scallops, and fish. It had a nice flavor and seasoning. The rice was cooked perfectly. It was a great dish.  We enjoyed our whole experience-including our service. We will definitely won't wait too long to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Paellea
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rum Flight #2 Shark Attack Shack

mkTxjpHiKWEzW1d_TOxCKw.text: When we want to sit outside in the summer months for a quick bite to eat and have a drink, we like this place.  The outside seating on the wraparound porch is very nice and the plantings have matured so your view of the Parking lot is obscured.    Bahama Breeze is a chain so the food is predictable but tasty     Glad this place is at Robinson Town Center.  Nice stop while we're out picking something up.

WbMdyiZbMaVhoxaIFj2UDw.text: I absolutely love this place! With the birth of our son, my husband and I started a tradition that we would bring any new members of our family here on the day they join our home. We brought both our biological children and also our foster children here. It's a "Welcome to the Family" celebration! We start off with the hummus appetizer which our 5 year old son is a big fan of. (Update: no longer on the menu) We also love their house salads with the cucumber sliver slices, pumpkin seeds, and crisp, tasty dressing! I ALWAYS get the paella which is AMAZEBALLS! Though I make it myself at home, theirs is way better! My husband always gets the Buttermilk Fried Chicken. We are creatures of habit and when you find something as delicious as these two menu items, you gotta stick with it!  We used to LOVE their coffee as it was Jamaican Blue Mountain; but they switched a while ago, and it's just not the same. Kinda my one let down now. Their frozen and tropical drinks are delicious, and we can never agree on just one dessert so we always order 2 or more. This time we got Chocolate Island (our go-to favorite) and a never-before tried Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside-Down Cake. Both lived up to expectations!  If you go on a weekend in the summer, they may have a band playing outside. Fingers crossed!  For a chain restaurant, this is one of the better ones! Darden owns your classic Olive Gardens and Red Lobsters which are good for chains, but they hit it out of the park with this concept! We are partial to Jamaican themed anything though as we honeymooned in Montego Bay.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside-Down Cake is chocolate cake w/chocolate molten center, caramelized pineapple &amp; raspberry sauce
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate Island is chocolate mousse on a brownie with anglaise sauce: OMG! Holy deliciousness! Yes, please!

7zQzSF6i9tzxgvQGpiCm7w.text: Tonight I had seafood paella at Bahamas Breeze the scallops were those little ones about the size of a quarter and that alone makes this dish underwhelming. I am not really sure why I thought the seafood would hearty and cooked properly but I did.   I probably won't be returning but if I did I definitely would try something other than paella.

WHnn93iUMwwV76SJIl4PLw.text: Let me start by saying the hostesses and waitstaff and bartenders were all very nice people. I ordered a margarita which was not very good and had to send it back. It had a very medicinal taste to it. I don't think was the bartender's fault because they have a margarita machine. Don't recommend it. Never, let me repeat never ever, order steak from this place. I ordered steak Oscar and the Quality of the steak was so poor, it almost tasted like liver. Also, parts of it was so chewy, I had to spit it out into my napkin. If you are going for the atmosphere, it's a fun place. But if you want quality food, choose someplace else.

TiwDp-vzd-58GBWrT7V0HQ.text: We have stopped several times at this establishment on our way to/from the airport.  It is a decent restaurant but I guess its biggest plus is the actual restaurant and the "summery" atmosphere it gives you.  We also never had any problem with the service but the food is nothing extraordinarily good.  It is not bad too, just normal, "neutral" food.  Having said that I believe it is a good option if it is on your way - and I am sure I will go back at some point - but I do not think I would go out of my way to have a meal here.

GQZXxlM5sFvatvJXj24uHw.text: Bahama Breeze has good food but horrible management. We made a reservation two days in advance for a 9-person party on my sister's birthday. We arrived 15 minutes prior to our reservation time, cake in hand. They had not reserved any tables for us because they just didn't have room, and then said we would have to wait for others to finish. This completely defeats the purpose of a RESERVATION. But the worst was yet to come. The general manager lied to us repeatedly... first she told us that a party table in the back had paid and were finishing their desserts. We watched as their first round of desserts were delivered 15 minutes later. Apparently at some point she told the party table that another party was waiting and they would need to leave soon. I would have been insulted if they had said this to me while I was enjoying my dinner, just to cover up for their incompetence. She even stationed servers near their table to put pressure on them to leave (she admitted this to us... wow). Later, another 9-person party table opened up, but we watched for 20 minutes as it remained dirty. We asked the manager if we could just sit there (we had been waiting for our RESERVED table for over an hour at this point), and she told us that she heard from somebody we didn't want to sit there. Another lie. The table remained unclean. She wouldn't even look us in the eye unless we went up to her first and her tone was overly rude all night. Finally an hour and a half later we were seated and given one free appetizer. Hooray. The waitress was great. If you make reservations here, don't expect them follow through.

vQHH4zxh95amCSI3wzVIRg.text: Bahama breeze is a fun place with fun bartenders. Definitely will be stopping in my next trip to pittsburgh.

WBRmw2q9Tf2QwjFyCAR3sQ.text: We had a party of twelve people for lunch so may have overwhelmed the staff  but service was slow.  Had the Applewood Bacon  burger.  It was OK (pretty hard to mess up a burger)  Family member ordered the cuban sandwich.  He did not like it.  Probably  because it wasn't  really  a cuban.  They don't come with salami,  lettuce, tomato and your supposed  to use cuban pork which this did not taste like.  ( I live near Miami so know Cuban food )  Overall, it was OK, nice atmosphere with so-so food.  Reasonable prices.

0v-vY-G3zqxBN1nfqxE2hg.text: When reviewing restaurants such as this one, immediately I want to lump it into a pool with other well known places like Applebees or Fridays simply due to its uncanning ability to seem mediocre. When you walk into Bahama Breeze, I can honestly say you will not feel like you are soaking up sun on the beaches of the Bahamas but I can say you will feel like you are in a large wooden building with slightly depressed servers all the while wondering why the ceiling fan is on in the middle of a 20 degree day in January to which you would later conclude that it's reasoning is to uphold the latter part of the establisments name. (That was a long sentence...pheww)  Well moving on, the food was pretty snazzy, I recommend the spinach dip since it was like giving your tongue a full massage. The beer was pretty normal..nothing special. I will say since there was no one there, I was asked if I was okay about 5 times..and that my friends is a new record.   If you are in the area and like places like this..check it out, it's worth a glance.

zREZMKgDfAec6qVwpNoYAg.text: This place is actually surprisingly delicious and may be one of my new favorite chains in Pittsburgh.  ****  We were craving a huge meal after a long day of Outlet Shopping before the holidays and we decided on Red Lobster. It's hard to beat those cheesy puffs things. I can hit a whole basketful easily in one sitting.  Apparently half of Pittsburgh was craving those same puffs. There was a waitlist for up to an hour. The T family never waits for food - so we decided to go to Bahama Breeze.  We grabbed a takeout menu and scanned it quickly. The prices seemed right as did the selection. We went for it.   And I can easily say that Bahamaa Breeze brought it. I was extremely satisfied with my almond coated tilapia fish dish, paired with garlic mashed potatotes, and thin green beans. The fish was fresh and buttery - and I almost felt like I was back in SF for a moment - the flavor was so distinct and delicious.  The rest of our party - was just as happy with their meal choices - finding the portions huge, and the quality and flavor - robust.  I have to dock a star though for the creme caramel cheescake, which I expected to be a stand-out. Especially since it was touted as being a Bahama Breeze special. It was grossly disappointing for it's off taste - and pricey for six dollars. I found myself doing something - which i NEVER do at a table.   I let everybody else finish it, while I just watched.   But sometimes - you just can't have it all - and I'd like to think that Bahama Breeze is capable of whipping up a quality desert - and I just happened to order the wrong one.

orxOWWujp-A-_uKucvMHnA.text: It almost felt like I wasn't in the chain-ey burbs of Pittsburgh when I sat on the deck!   Definitely a new stable in my restaurant routine.    Pros: Fresh Fish, summery drink list, outdoor seating   Cons: Cheesy uniforms   I will be back!

6HBVxTY6Ztek8EdKRf0GjQ.text: I generally avoid rating chain restaurants, but I am obsessed with Bahama Breeze and try to visit one everywhere I go.  Usually places that have an "exotic" decor relative to what you're used to are just banking on that, and the food isn't anything special.  Well, I've eaten at this BB on three separate occasions, and I've found the food to be consistently delicious, the staff friendly, and the atmosphere delightful.  I've been here with a lot of former Disney cast members like myself, and we've all agreed that the way the staff here handles its customers is admirably similar to the Disney standard.  It's been a few years since I've been here so I don't really recall what I had to eat besides the onion rings, which were big, juicy, and crispy.  I'd love to come back next time I go home to visit.  (I currently live in San Diego.)

DAaV-NkQa9miLKlTHGSjSQ.text: This was one of the more fascinating restaurants I have seen on the inside. the view was very pleasant, staff was extremely nice and fast with their food I am very impressed I recommend if you like seafood to at least visit this place in Pittsburgh it's worth the while.

S_BGDiAm7i7e4Oxv_fz2Gg.text: This restaurant is decent. The appetizers are quite good, but there aren't too many great options available for lunch or dinner entrees.  One nice thing is that there usually isn't too long of a wait at this location, even on weekend nights.

--HD2bEhT7PANoZJFeIi1g.text: At a loss for a new place to explore and write about, Kay and I journeyed to the chain restaurant stronghold of Robinson the other night for the dining choices in this suburban kingdom are multitudinous. If I was to eat at a chain on this evening (and I do so often and somewhat willingly), it was going to be a place that offers the kind of food we don't get much of in Western PA. The decor is as kitschy as a B-52's gig. Giant straw canopies hang from the ceiling. The pillars appear to be made from trees. None of the help looks or sounds as if they hail from the Carribean, but it is likely that some of them spent or will spend a Spring Break there. Billy Ocean didn't drop in. Ben Zephaniah probably wouldn't like the place. Jimmy Buffet might own stock in the franchise. Authentic or not though (and I certainly have my doubts), Bahama Breeze lived up to its namesake in that the food was just easy to like. Our opener was a serving of the Crab Claws St. Thomas. Blue crab is used, the generous amount of tiny claws swimming in a snappy "Island Citrus Butter". A loaf of pillowy "Cuban Bread" comes to the table in a bag (to keep it fresh) for the purposes of soaking up that wonderful butter. The crab claws were fun to eat and required no hardware or labor. You just put them in your mouth and pull that dainty meat off with your teeth. If there were 100 of them, we would have finished them all with extreme prejudice. I so wanted to try Jerk Chicken, but at Bahama Breeze it's served with pasta, which seems so...touristy? Is that the right word? Note #1-One really cool thing Bahama Breeze does is offer a "lighter portion" of many of their dishes, a godsend for those on a diet or on a budget as you get less food and pay a little less. That little perk almost made me order the Jerk Chicken Pasta as well as a few of their other entrees. Being True to my blue-collar, sandwich-loving, Friday-state-of-mind self, I instead ordered a Cuban since I really wanted to try a good one, not a Panera-grade one (see my reviews archive). Lo and behold, it's a dandy and flattened oven-baked Italian hoagie with Swiss cheese in lieu of Provolone, "Cuban" bread in lieu of Italian, pork, and more familiar components in tomato, lettuce, and mayonnaise. No pickle or mustard was to be found, however. Not that I minded as this was one hearty yet tidy and planar hero, artfully sliced in half on a bias. Note #2-Another cool thing about Bahama Breeze is their choice of sides. In the case of sandwiches, the choices include mere french fries, a tomato salad, yellow rice with black beans, and my pick; the brisk, fresh, palate-restoring fruit salad. Grapes danced with pineapple chunks in a ramekin as a small scoop of orange sherbet oversaw the affair. Kay's Chicken with Cilantro Crema was good enough, but the mashed potatoes that accompanied it were a symphony of spud, roasted corn, and a trio of cheeses. For dessert, we traded off on the Chocolate Island and the Bananas Supreme. Once again, cultural cred is in question, but the flavors were undeniable. I preferred the mousse/brownie silo that is the Island and the sea of chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise that surrounded it. The Bananas Supreme is Bananas Foster collaborating with that school fundraiser classic, Banana Nutbread. It's warm, there's butterscoth, brandy, and vanilla ice cream involved; it's an effortless winner. Being that this Bahama Breeze is the only one of its kind in this side of the state, it's easy to forget that you're dealing with a chain here. The quality food only helps to further that end. And now...Bad Brains... youtube.com/watch?v=N2Ke...

YQZHmSKOMGhzouhxVP7-kw.text: Everyone's food was excellent. I had the salmon with some kind of fruit salsa and it was cooked perfectly. Server was friendly and attentive. Restrooms are always clean. I've had some other dishes here in the past and can't recall ever having a bad meal or experience

zRQ1VYUeDO-HpflQqGMF0A.text: I love the Breeze, I'm a huge fan of really good black bean soup, no one does it better than the Breeze. They're version is low in fat, vegan, and pretty high in sodium, but so is most restaurant food. A bowl makes a great lite lunch and is rather filling.  NOTE* the rest of this review goes back to my pre vegan days.  The Breeze has the best shrimp 'n grits this side of New Orleans, I've had shrimp n grits in Bay St Louis, New Orleans, and Shreveport, and you just can't beat the fresh shrimp caught right out of the ocean, but Bahama Breeze makes up for it with tons of cheddar in the grits, lots of butter and cream too. The shrimp are good, not rubbery, they use 21-30 count shrimp and you get quite a bit. The creamy grits, the succulent shrimp, and the spicy coating on the shrimp is like a party in your mouth, it's not always available, the four times I had it, they were part of the nightly specials.  When I stopped here for lunch I'd always get a Cuban sandwich. They are big in Florida, it's hard to find them here. Delicious garlic roasted pork, salty ham, creamy swiss cheese, tart dill pickles, spicy brown mustard, all toasted on a pressed cuban loaf. Does that make your mouth water? It does mine! Wash this beauty down with a red ale or pale ale and you'll be thanking me for the rest of your life.  Bahama Breeze is one of the better restaurants from the Dardan Restaurant group.

9SGYB7TSnmCfBz6rDYrRNw.text: 1st time here few weeks ago and I LOVE THIS PLACE! the place was spacious, food was great, staff was wonderful and not to mention 1/2 off everything on the appetizer menu!!!! and if you feel like your breath is kickin' there's complimentary mouthwash in the bathroom ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chicken and plantains
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. ribs and fries
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. appetizer shrimp!!!

b0h9cOQ-g4otioM0n4AMkw.text: A very welcoming restaurant with a great menu that really makes an attempt to capture a Caribbean theme. The alcoholic menu was superb. We had Bahama mamas and a strawberry daiquiri and they were very enjoyable. Even though the restaurant seemed full of patrons, our meals were served to us in a very timely manner and we couldn't have been happier.

-7rTYnDMRiMuNSxFR4bsbg.text: We came here saturday afternoon for lunch and had a very pleasant experience! We had the crab, shrimp, mango, and avocado stack which was absolutely amazing.  The crab and shrimp was very fresh and the mango and avocado complimented them perfectly.    I had the coconut shrimp and Bill ordered the swordfish.  We were both very impressed by how fresh and light his swordfish was....literally melted in your mouth! And....coconut shrimp is my absolute favorite and I felt that the shrimp was cooked just right and not at all rubbery.  The service was okay but the atmosphere was very peaceful and for a second made us think we were back home in Florida! I would definitely go back.  CON: It is on the pricier side but, nothing extreme just average "chain restaurant" prices.

Z8W9NJKR2kQVOfAChiCLaQ.text: I normally don't love chains but didn't have much choice coming into Pittsburgh late. The food was fantastic. Very flavorful and fresh. They don't actually take reservations but they put you on a running list "in case." Didn't really get that but we didn't wait anyway at 830pm.  Service was very polite and helpful.  We started with the baked goat cheese appetizer stuffed into bell peppers with crostini. Unbelievable! I had the Chicken Santiago which was also very good and my colleague had the almond-crusted mahi mahi special with mashed sweet potatoes. Very fresh and perfectly cooked. If I'm in the area again I will probably go back.

qOiB1hLBA0-3Jh09Xg9kdA.text: Every time I try and explain the inside of Bahama Breeze, people make fun of me. Usually because I start off by saying it's as if I'm on a Caribbean cruise. In all seriousness, I felt as though I was eating on a cruise ship overlooking the ocean. It was a different and awesome experience.  Both the food and service were great! I received a coupon in the mail and decided to take a chance. My waitress was very friendly and knew her stuff. I told her what kind of things I liked and she was able to recommend the Seafood Paella (assorted seafood, chicken, sausage and peas with yellow rice). Usually the first bite tells you how the rest of the meal will go. Immediately, I could tell how fresh my dish was and because of that, it made the meal even more amazing. Although Bahama Breeze was a bit pricey, it was well worth it!

gK5MqtG4YMw-H_qu7QYPdw.text: Quite expensive but the food is great. Very balanced dishes with great flavor.  Servers were very nice and accommodating. Expect to spend close to 40$ for a meal for two.

-IRS7vUSj0MYRSoCajBtjw.text: The food was average at best.  The service was below average.  We went for a birthday celebration and ordered some appetizers.  The Edamame arrived covered by a bowl but the bowl was dirty.  The Warm Spinach Dip was pretty tasteless.  The steak Frites and Jerk Chicken Pasta were decent but the Fish Tacos were a mess and not very tasty.  The drinks were overpoured and not very well made.  The service bar was extremely slow and it took quite a while to even get our drinks.  Finally, we had made a reservation several days prior to the dinner and the hostess acted like she was doing us a favor by seating us.  Not the best experience.

DAYsWVc9CpB30Lx7B2ED2Q.text: A pleasant atmosphere and good food.  The bar is cordial and the environment warm.  As a "beach" knockoff for PA and airport you'd be better off to jump a quick flight to a warmer climate where actual tall tanned individuals serve legitimately tropical drinks, instead of manufactured attempts.

dtUJVUDbOywxNO06JTVoRA.text: We stopped by here for lunch the next day before heading home from the Garth Brooks concert. We checked out the menu and decided we would give it a shot. The atmoshpere was nice. The dining areas were clean and decorations were nice. I ordered the Seafood Paella, two shared the Shrimp Linguine, and one other ordered the Fish Tacos. The food seemed like it took an unreasonable amount of time to get to our table despite the restaurant being almost empty of customers. We watched as the shrimp tacos sat under the food warmer for at least 15 minutes before being brought to us. The linguine tasted like it had too much of an Italian type seasoning on it. The Paella had hardly any flavor. The shrimp and scallops were plain. The chicken was okay along with the fish. The muscles were muscles. Can't go wrong there. I may have just been expecting a more flavorful dish for the price we were paying. I'm never a person to complain but it seemed that there was much room for improvement. I would return to give another chance.

r8nY2LQB_haDS4i5_Qz2dw.text: I haven't been to a Bahama Breeze in many years since they closed in Rochester. During that time, I used to frequent this restaurant on a fairly regular basis and really enjoyed the food and carribean theme. I was pleasantly surprised to find that Pittsburg still had the location open and was eager to give it a try.  We ordered Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp for an appetizer. It was spicy and delicious. The sauce and warm bread that it is served with is amazing. For our entrees, we had Baby Back Ribs and the Coconut Shrimp dinner. My husband loves the ribs! The meat was falling off the bone and he felt like they were some of the best ribs that he's ever had. He would definitely order these again. I had the coconut shrimp meal. I was really skeptical about ordering the coconut shrimp, but went ahead and gave it a try. I'm glad that I did because it was phenomenal. It wasn't overly sweet like others places serve their coconut shrimp. The only down side was that the rice was extremely dry and hardened. We ordered a cocktail too. They have a very large variety from which to choose.   Service was good. Can't wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribs
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut shrimp
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lights on booth

FbN7GDI9OoDOzFEmuBtShQ.text: Taylor O. what a wonderful bartender she is!! From the moment sat down she had a friendly smile and greeted me warmly! She suggested many things off of the Happy- Hour menu and I really enjoyed my mojito and firecracker shrimp!!! I will surely be back to visit her again during the hours she is working! I wish I could give her 10/10 stars because it was such a wonderful experience for my first time at Bahama Breeze!!

5Bmn0PY3ZT54cS3GuEfFKg.text: My husband and I don't frequent mega-chain restaurants. However, when we're looking for something clean, fresh and relatively quick Bahama Breeze never disappoints. Today our server Ariel was speedy, knowledgeable and very professional. I thought my mojito was a little on the sweet side but our lunch entrees were perfect. Also a major thank you to the hostess for not making me do your job for you!

7sdZZC4fkqcOFz1Qft21RQ.text: This is by far one of my favorite chain restaurants. Ever since I discovered the jerk chicken pasta dish years ago I have been hooked. I've tried making the recipe myself using recipes found online and nothing ever compares to theirs. If you've never tried it I highly recommend you give it a try. The chicken is cooked perfectly, the sauce is the perfect amount of spice, and the asparagus and mushrooms are a great addition to the dish.  On top of that this place has delicious drinks. This time around we went with the jalapeno watermelon margaritas and it was so good that we ordered a second pitcher. The ambience of this restaurant is always delightful as well. Even on a wet rainy day you can go here and feel like you are off on a vacation.

Wk8xsPbRIzdiaMbEE5sWCg.text: I'm in the area today shopping, and decided to stop here for lunch. It looks so cool inside that we opted to sit inside rather than outside, inspire of the fantastic weather today. That's how nice the decor is.  This time around we tried the coconut mojitos.  They were great!  For lunch, I got the half jerk chicken and tortilla soup. The soup was great, packed with flavor.  The jerk chicken not so much.  It was very bland, too bland to be Jamaican jerk chicken. The included on the side BBQ sauce, even just a little, completely dominated the chicken.  So if you want flavor, probably try a different dish. I'm trying a burger next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half jerk chicken sandwich and tortilla soup.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut mojito

8ME4H7csbfccesoTEIvRHA.text: My co workers and I went here for lunch today during work.  We sat outside which I loved. Granted, today was extremely warm for November. It was 75 today but they have heaters outside just in case it is chilly and you wanna enjoy the meal outside.  Our waiter kita, was very pleasant and fast. She was very knowledgeable of the menu and super friendly.   I order shrimp and lobster quesadilla with the seafood chowder. The quesadilla was ok, there was not a lot in them so I won't order that again, but the soup was perfection. It was enough food that was I wasn't super hungry after. I definitely had room for dessert but we didn't have much time.  The lunch combo was reasonably priced around 10 dollars but there was a very vast menu so there are plenty of options

7bJzE8fGrFYIuJmQRYz8NQ.text: Bleh.  We made the mistake of stopping for lunch at a chain restaurant. Bland food, over priced, dirty. However, our server was very good.

inpcB5bWNeTHYnRbdpePUw.text: Whenever I'm in the mood to hit the beach but it happens to be January in Pittsburgh, this is my go-to. True Caribbean feel. Fresh seafood entrees, refreshing fruity drinks and tropical decor and music! Recently came here with a party of 6 and I was so impressed that the waitress was able to memorize all of our orders without writing a single thing down, she didn't skip a beat! This place does get crowded so be wise about what time you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caribbean - Style Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese

iMF4d-zs0gtA6EvS1pIbiA.text: 4 stars because the drinks, customer service, and atmosphere are great. I would give the food 2.5-3 stars, though. It's really hit and miss. The food has really good flavor, but I think the ingredients are on the cheaper side. Drinks are seriously amazing though!

mk9mpK1DurG2vIGhedBjbg.text: I have not often been to a place of such trashery. First of all- how do you burn sauteed salmon. This is debauchery! The building was cold as my asparagus. I wrote a haiku about the Bahama Breeze in Robinson township.  Bahama Breeze ew. My salmon was burnt ew gross. Get me out of here!

vTXFIFVNbyUWb3dPhVhsDQ.text: Three of us got the shrimp and grits which I thought was very good and stacked up well to the others I've had and went well both one of their margaritas. The fish tacos were tasty and fresh from what my girlfriend said. The staff was very accommodating to our big party size and attentive with a good atmosphere I definitely will be back.

DvLPE8tWe3gj2urHryCkrg.text: I had an absolutely wonderful experience here. The host immediately greeted us and sat us to a table. Our server, Taylor, was very friendly, offering up various menu options and being patient as we took a longer time to order since it was our first time here. Our food was delicious and came out quick and hot! I literally had no complaints!  But the part that made me very happy was the fact that the host made sure to check on the servers before seating them so that they had enough time to care for each guest. I work in the restaurant industry and to see teamwork like this is rare to be honest. You can tell they are working together, and looking out for each other, as well as the restaurant. I can't wait to come back!i

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vO8kIuLb-ue_GICGHpY7eQ.text: I've eaten at a different Bahama Breeze location and it wasn't nearly as bad as this one. First off I had to keep convincing myself that our server wasn't the least competent person on planet earth, he kept proving me wrong. The food was mushy and lacking of quality you would expect at a place like this. The manager did stop by to pick up the slack of her waitstaff to refill my drink. The only positive was the appetizer. Shame I'll never get back the dollars spent here.

RxKYcevgLmhUQEzMgdIjow.text: Here we go again!  First impressions last a lifetime. Upon entering I was told my party of 3 would have a 15 to 20 minute wait time. One third of the tables were empty and there were employees everywhere standing around doing nothing. I am not a fan of open kitchens, i watched several employees  goofing around, pushing and shoving in the food prep and line area. I went to use the rest room during my wait. Filthy and unkempt,  this is typically a bad sign in any restaurant, they definitely do not have a daily cleaning regime. After being seated at a dirty table I had look at menu, very predictable.  No thank you. Our waitress had an afro the size of a beach ball, I thought we had health codes regarding hair in food service industries in Pennsylvania. I guess they wanted me to feel like I was in the Bahamas. I don't like eating human hair, I opted just to have a cup of coffee, acceptable at best. My wife got some seafood dish that resembled a bad idea. My daughter got pre packaged frozen chicken and stale tasting frozen fries. Well once again I am focusing on the bad, but when you are slapped in the face with it, you get my point. This place is nothing more than fast food. I just can't figure out how the bar got lowered so low. It's just embarrassing.  I am always expected to give my best performance at my job, no less. Why have we become so accepting of pre packaged, mediocre, lack luster, lazy, dirty and ect. These chain restaurants are disgraceful and when the ownership and their staff don't get it right the first time, I will not ever be back. Thanks for your time.

BrCLMxxQbArz329_DeQOdQ.text: I thought 3.5 stars a little unfair for this restaurant. I was hesitating about this place but my friend had recommended it to me so I have it a try. They have a lot of types of drinks and I was glad they also had not alcohol drinks. BTY I recommend their Virgin Pina Colada. I enjoyed sitting outside since the weather was good, I felt I was near to the Ocean or in the West (lol!!) because of the decoration and the latino music. I just thought the meal took so long for coming so I recommend you order some tapas or little bites.

p1BfWZqw4vNE87hzTalWnw.text: Really like the Caribbean atmosphere.  Wasn't too sure about the mac & cheese w/ a deep fried lobster tail, but the lobster ended up being good & tender.  The jerk chicken & pasta was lacking mostly chicken although it tasted fine.  Really enjoyed the rum flight. Creme brulee good (made fancy by putting in a pineapple ring & using a paper umbrella)

PB6h0pwin4w8jCZPc05tBA.text: Memoriesss, of when I was a wee girl and got hammered for the first time at a Bahama Breeze in GA. And also celebrated my 28th bday while on business in Orlando... And Now this location when my other flight crew showed up tipsy, embarrassed us by telling the bartender "Just surprise me with any drink, but make it dark like my soul!" (Then later SPILLED a drink all over the bar!) Anyway I throughly enjoyed the pinot with a "light" sized Mahi/Shrimp rice bowl and it was so friggin delicious. Lots of veggies, fresh and affordable. All ingredients for a four star+ review!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 75% of the Flight crew

A5Zt4_3KLD2MASpkC0dB3w.text: Warning! Our party of 4 was told it would be a 15-20 minute wait. After waiting for 20 minutes (no problem. Expected on a Saturday night at a chain restaurant) , we checked in and were told it would be another 45 minutes!  There were many empty tables that were apparently "closed." The hostess seemed shocked we were upset-we could have been informed earlier and made the decision to go elsewhere.   We wasted valuable time on our way to a performance and ended up having to eat Five Guys in the car. I am beyond disgusted by the incompetence and I will never go back.

NOOjtRMPzdQqfE5q8cv5dw.text: We have been to this location several times. I'm not real big on chain restaurants but this is one I don't mind going to. They are always accommodating for making a dish the way you like it. Their plantains are always good perfect! Would definitely recommend this location.

Dp6v60hK2a2eC3BH5LiQGA.text: Loved the experience of dining here!   Food: We ordered a variety of dishes, including the nachos without beef, chicken quesadilla, and my personal favorite - the jackfruit tacos. Personally I found the chicken quesadilla a bit dry. However, the jackfruit tacos were mind blowing and very unique. They came with a side dish, so we chose the black bean soup which was better than most I've tasted elsewhere. Their drinks menu was also really impressive - I want to come back here to try the margarita flight, which includes a hibiscus margarita and tamarind margarita.   Service: Our server was Earl, and he was very attentive, polite, and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised with the service we received, even during peak weekend hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ultimate Pineapple
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jackfruit tacos with black bean soup

pMEwkFNko1uE92jy_tgRfQ.text: This is a wonderful restaurant that takes you away to the islands, even though it's just a chain.  They really train their wait staff to give you the best experience.   The service at the bar was slow, but that was due to a call off.  When the drinks did come, I was pleasantly surprised. It was the flight of margaritas. The perfect size and taste for an evening of dinning.    I would come back again and again. The jerk chicken is legit, even if it's not from Jamaica.   Have you tried the plantains? Yes please! If you're new to this place, don't hesitate on trying the most delicious thing on the menu.   Don't write off all chains, they aren't created equal. I'll be back!

wSCKM5wuUXgSGtGxj609sg.text: I am never really a fan of chain restaurants, but Bahama Breeze always impresses me. The service is always quick and friendly, and their entrees are mostly high quality. I love the live one man band on Friday evenings!

o6JPWjsfJgb6RU4ErSCNRg.text: Bleh. Slow service. Mediocre food. If you are looking for a fun place to eat with good food and friendly atmosphere, this ain't it, chief.

U79Mes9HQT0Is9bdjK0DTQ.text: Delicious pineapple drink! They add a good amount of rum. Not expensive I believe under $15. We got there around 6pm there was a 40 minute wait so we just sat at the bar. Grilled jerk shrimp skillet is amazing!!! Also, my appetizer was a crab meat atop of shrimp tower and avocado and pineapple. The picture shows a tower up on a red spicy sauce that is really hot,but works great with the pineapple and avocado. Enjoy!!  Sometimes a group of servers can get you that five star rating. This group is almost there, but don't be sad if you are not dazzled by the service (just B- on service).

w7a7EiyHnZKOwFwYQ_lJxQ.text: Stunningly slow service with high prices on average food. I'll eat here again but probably won't be excited about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QOLPSVQmRtlJUBcFnZpQag.text: Ate here with a large group from work. Our service was very good considering the size of our group (about 20 people). The coconut shrimp tacos were so good! The other grilled fish tacos weren't as good. It was pretty busy even for a Weds night. My co-workers all raved about their food as well.

J_95IddtZBS6GKS9Kach3g.text: Had not visited in a while. But pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is great. They do an excellent job of copying the environment of the Caribbean. And everyone, and I mean everyone was so nice!  From the moment we walked thru the front door until we left we received smiles and good service. Waitress was very attentive, and helpful. And the food was delicious, and very affordable. Will revisit soon.

M-LUqpabX4J7Bu8sr8Ikkw.text: Only one star, because Yelp requires at least one star. Terrible experience. Got there the front door is broken for over a month. The staff has to come to the door and let you in because the door will not open. Apparently they will not have it fixed. We ordered two drinks 2 glasses of water and two appetizers. We got our drinks after several minutes no water no setups, and one appetizer only. The price for a 9 oz pour of Kendall Jackson chardonnay was $14.79. even in Pennsylvania that is more than the cost of the bottle at the wine and spirits store. The happy hour here used to be much much better, but apparently corporate greed has taken over. We have been coming here for at least 10 years and had many happy hours here. We expressed our concerns to several of the employees this evening about these issues, but no one took it to the attention of any manager. We will not be returning!!!

0kEcznnd6Qdtrj3RsjLBjw.text: called for a reservation for 4 to sit outside. go there waited 30 minutes to be seated outside only for them to give our table away to a party of 3 that "ordered too much food so they needed to sit at a bigger table". eventually sat us at the round rock table at the end. and part of their porch was "under construction" so they couldn't sit us at an actual table.   Edit: Our server Chase was awesome though and accommodated us the best he could. Definitely deserves a raise! He ran the show outside.

ozlm5hD-ncJBEYkgHfrn0g.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!! If you're looking for authentic Caribbean good, you've come to the right place. The theme is so amazing, each booth has different beach type theme with bright colors everywhere you look. It is pricey but totally worth it!! Everyone was so nice and friendly I will be back!

qKllq3GgJmZjqOGvqPl44w.text: Only good thing was my pina colada. They ran out of the dish I ordered for dinner so I ordered the paella which was bland and unappetizing. The crispy cheese bites weren't good and some were still cold in the middle. Service was poor at best. I wasn't expecting much and I was still let down.

hIpyw_vZ8Oe9N5_8pO-hZQ.text: Enjoyed dinner two nights in a row this past weekend.  Limited wait.  Good food and cocktails.  Service was excellent our first night, but something was off the second night - waiter was inattentive.  Overall a good experience and we would return.

LlSnE5eMlabhy0LEX1XT5Q.text: Our first time here so we decided to sit at the bar and the bartenders were very helpful!!! Taylor and Steve thank you for the great experience!!! I ordered the coconut shrimp tacos and I didn't care for them but that's my opinion. My husband ordered some seafood and rice plate, rice was very dry but GREAT taste!!! I will definitely be back!!! Next time I'm trying the jerk chicken sandwich!!

SbIyVbzitShOpF9YRO_p0Q.text: Great live music and happy hour deals.  Felt like I was on vacation. Drinks and food were good. Service was a little slow though.

JVcCtf8TCSqUN8uhUyw5Og.text: Amber was my server, and she was very friendly.....I ordered a white sangria which was probably good sans so much ice. For my entree I ordered their Chipotle Chicken Taco Salad, I like it but it's pretty basic......My item to order over and over again is their version of Conch Fritters (with a delicious citrus mustard sauce), Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Had potential, smh
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy!

BBAA4uiJkYEa0s52h7cDVw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants back home so I decided to give it a try in a completely different state while out of town for work.  I was not disappointed.  The jerk chicken was grilled to perfection.  Very moist and flavorful while avoiding being under cooked.  This restaurant, also, has great appetizers.  My favorites include the skillet simmered jerk shrimp, chicken wings, coconut shrimp, and beef empanadas.  If you can visit during happy hour when appetizers are half priced, I strongly encourage you to do so.  This place has great food and a tremendously friendly environment.  The staff is very helpful.  Another dish that is great for seafood lover's is the seafood paella.  No matter what you hunger is, Bahama Breeze has numerous selections that can satisfy your appetite.  Don't hesitate to drop by.
