OZnzJqXHnyD3mnz3J_mpQA.text: Boring dump of restaurant Expected Caribbean soothing tunes... Got hip hop playing? Contrary to the brand Few people visiting, assume restaurant teetering on making or losing money. Order Happy hour 1/2 price apps. Great deal and Jerk wings absolutely great and better than any I've tasted elsewhere.  Wings will bring me back , but music not reggae based. 4.00 20 Oz beers during happy hour.

xcG_KKlvl4WTqxePiQI6zQ.text: They advertise coconut shrimp tacos on the menu, and then say they are out of them. Then 5 minutes later the waitress says they aren't out of them, there's just a $3.99 "upcharge" that's hidden. Don't jerk your customers around like this when there are literally a dozen other restaurants within view.  Edited: ok the manager fixed it, but why go through this hassle for shrimp tacos?  Edited: nope, they screwed up 100% of all orders at the table and half the guests left without good. How does this even happen?

vKLzsdgighsehVVPvd7R6A.text: We had lunch on a Saturday and had the best waitress.  The Caribbean music that was playing was so nice and relaxing.  I just love the restaurants decor.   I ordered the new appetizer - Yucca Sticks.. tasted like potatoes and cheese..  so good.  I love the dipping sauces!!  I had the chipotle chicken salad and it was very filling.   My boyfriend had the burger and we were surprised at how small it was.. it was the size of a children's burger.   My boyfriend liked the burger and I even had a bite - it was good but for the price.. we would have preferred it be a regular size burger at least.   Hopefully this is  one time thing.. we will be returning and hopefully the burger will be a little better.   Thanks Bahama Breeze .  ..

The drinks were good as well. My server was Page and, she was EXCELLENT!! She was on top of everything we needed ! I will definitely be back

Yx0mvnXmd2Gsax3h7CzUFA.text: So far...no good.  Brought a beer from the bar 30 minutes ago and the empty is still sitting on the table.  Ordered an appetizer but had no silverware or plates.  The person who brought the app brought silver and said "let me go look for plates.". Seriously...look for plates.  Should we have brought our own?  Anyway, ate the app without plates after waiting for 7 minutes for those lost plates and both of us made a mess on our shirts.  Told the waitress and her excuse was...I have another party.  How the hell is that my problem?  So...funny.  I have ordered 2 beers since sitting down and she has yet to pick up the bottle I brought from the bar.  I must have cooties.  The food was average at best.  The rice and beans were soupy, the guacamole had 2 very pretty shades of green, pretty but probably not fresh.  Both dinners were cold but we were hungry.  Probably won't be back.  When you have poor service and lousy meals sure does not make it worth it.

mMrpjfUkPgk81cN7yLjJ8Q.text: It's very upsetting for me to give a one star but it's deserved after my experience the other night. I've eaten here several times 20+, it was my favorite get away spot in Pittsburgh...the food and drinks are great!! However, the servers can be a pain!!MICHELLE made me never want to come back ever again!!!!!

13q65-1o060psmxP5FjU_Q.text: We were actually on the way to Olive Garden but were caught up by Bahama Breeze as there're many people setting at the porch at 5:30pm. We're first time here and found out they have happy hours 50% off on liquors and appetizers. Nobody taking care of us after we'd been setting at the table for 10mins. Finally a waiter named Gregory came to us explained and apologized for the wait. He also got us the 50% off appetizer (the wings) after happy hour. It's nicely handled. Despite the wait, the foods are great. We ordered the seafood paella, Jamaica chicken wings, and the BBQ ribs.   The wings are really good, highly recommended! The paella has many ingredients in it; the size is quite large, good for parties of 2-3. The BBQ ribs are juicy and savory. We're glad that we did go to Olive Garden.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jamaica chicken wings

hLL3ggmyfa4BaqaNAAwL0Q.text: Went there tonight and had a good time. We ordered the Rum Raid **WARNING** the flight of drinks was surprisingly strong, so start with one and then decide if you need another. I recommend the Painkiller, Dreamin' of Blue Seas, the Dark & Stormy, and/or good ole Bahama Mama if you decide you don't want the flight. For dinner I had the shrimp and mahi with lemongrass sauce bowl. The flavors were well blended, yet individual enough to stand alone. My boyfriend got the Caribbean style lobster mac & cheese. He enjoyed it but thought the battered and fried lobster was an unforgivable culinary crime, as it did not match the "lightly fried" description he anticipated. The rum cake (with ice cream) was a fair compromise for groups that include individuals that might not want coconut or key like flavored dessert.

L57RAfFUFY0FNqy-fpN70Q.text: I haven't been to a Bahama Breeze in a long time, but let me tell you - we had a stellar experience.   I went with a group of coworkers and we all raved about our specialty drinks and dinner platters. There were endless options which made it difficult, but we were all happy with what we ordered.   I ordered salmon and it was cooked to perfection. It was everything I was hoping it would be. My one coworker is a vegetarian and she forgot to ask for no bacon in her platter. When it came out and had bacon all in it, we mentioned it to our sever, but she didn't bat an eye even though it wasn't her mistake. She took the plate back to the kitchen right away and made sure it was cooked properly.   The restaurant had a really fun, festive vibe inside and like I said, our server was amazing. She was very attentive and seemed to really enjoy her job. Her name was Kayla.  Bahama Breeze is definitely a new favorite for me and I can't wait to go back.

v70fFqq0tpRaIPVG75JpeA.text: Had to wait a sec for someone to get to my table to help me, but when someone noticed I was quick to get my order taken and my drink (Virgin Pina Colada with mango) and my appetizer (Buttermilk Chicken Jibaritos).  After my Virgin Pino Colada, I got an IBC Root Beer and my entree (Calypso Shrimp Linguine). It was all delicious and will definitely be coming back. I put the rest of my entree in a box and had their Rum Cake for dessert. It is a clean restaurant, friendly staff, and wonderful food and atmosphere. I would definitely be recommending this to alot of my friends. Anthony and Anntonietta are awesome

She is having lobster linguini. My wife is having shrimp basket. I don't have any seafood paella. Oh these dishes served with a smile and there's plenty of food

FqIHiWdNDYiPPw3Zo6xNfw.text: Waited an hour and a half for our food, and there were empty tables.   They were out of what my son ordered.  They made a mistake with my husband's order so that he had to wait even longer for his. When the waiter brought out everyone else's meal, she also brought out the combo appetizer platter, which we had already ordered, received and eaten as our appetizer because apparently they made an extra one and so she was somehow bestowing this gift upon us free of charge...none of us wanted any more of that bc our main meals were now in front of us.  To top it off, when she placed this gratuitous appetizer platter on our table, the accompanying sauce spilled in my husband's lap.  The food quality is marginal at best.  Oh, and on our way inside, we witnessed a kitchen employee sitting outside in front of the restaurant on the curb smoking a cigarette.  Yuck.  Never going back to this place.

Y7dXAqWX3Hhh_R7t9OVYnw.text: First off I have to say Anthony is amazing and when you visit here ask for him by name. His personality and attention to detail is top notch. On to the food. We ordered the shrimp and lobster quesadilla which was solid along with the sampler. The wings were tasty and had good heat, the coconut shrimp were good along with the conch. She ordered Mahi Mahi special and loved it. I had the steak Oscar. Steak was cooked to order and crab was decent.   For our drinks I ordered the red lager and she had a coconut mojito. The beer was good and not overpowering but the mojito was solid. We didn't opt for desert after all we tasted but can't wait to return.

U0bvcNqQgKQwP2FsYuan0g.text: This was a crazy busy ridiculous location Never saw the Vegas location so busy  But we did get seats at the bar and sat with Taylor.  My friend got steak and I got paella.  We had the hibiscus margaritas and they were good.  The paella was good.  Saturday night is busy and crowded on Saturday night

rXkB4Qlg1pswyZDq8UUgfQ.text: I've come here during Happy Hour twice now and will continue to come back for the great food, wonderful drinks, and quality service. This is the only Bahama Breeze in Pittsburgh (I believe the next closest one is in King of Prussia) so it doesn't feel like a chain to me. My favorite drink is the Yaka Hula Hickey Dula featuring rum, Reisling and pineapple juice. So good! I recently tried the Skillet-Simmered Jerk Shrimp which was AMAZING! The shrimp is served in a mini skillet in a wonderful juice blend of thyme, garlic, and veggies with a mini loaf of Cuban bread to dip into the skillet juice. This is one of the best dishes I ever had!  You can either eat indoors or outdoors. On a beautiful day, I definitely choose the outdoors. The only thing that would make the scenery ideal is a real ocean breeze and ocean to hear and overlook as you dine.

MqBAJyndtwu-QH0MWvIrdg.text: Went there with my family for my wife's birthday. Wonderful atmosphere  and great food. Everyone really enjoyed themselves. Wait staff was excellent. Thank you.

0ucEkNGqqYTeYgt-C_loAA.text: Had the fish tacos and they were great. Waiter suggested try them blackened and I'm glad I did. I will be going back when in town. Service was a little slow but still very good and friendly.

iy_-HHWievfFvgHKkr6D_g.text: It used to be better.  But I still enjoy going there once in awhile.

8ddDUKs3gr5bW43Ep8lWvA.text: We ate at Bahama breeze Robinson twp tonight.... We have eaten there 50 times before with no problem.... Tonight my husband and I both ordered Cuban sandwiches which were funky tasting and really bad smelling... We send them back.... The manager assured us that they were fine..... Yuck..... He asked us to order something else....40 minutes later we received our new dinner and we were rewarded with a new check that was $20 more than the original would have been.... He never checked back.... I guess we were to blame for the funky pork..... Will never ever return...there are way too many great chain restaurants to frequent .... Bye bye Bahama breeze!!!!!!!

byYP20vcu04CavxV8RPgkw.text: Great place in the dead or winter for a little Caribbean style fun. It's a little franchise feeling but service and food is great.

WiFGomeqnhadJ-lnjzmibg.text: What's not to like about a restaurant that makes you forget that it's 45F, grey, and raining outside (like today)?    Bahama Breeze, in Robinson Town Center, is one of my favorite places to stop on the way to or from Pittsburgh International Airport.  On a crowded night the spacious covered wrap around porch or indoor bar make for comfortable places to sip a colada, Mojito, or 'tini while waiting for your pager to summon you to dinner.  Harry Belafonte tunes like "Man Smart (Women Smarter)"  and other steel drum laden favorites set the tone for fun as you stroll up to the porch entry.  Inside, the vibrant Caribbean themed decor has an authentic, 'upscale' flare (without being over done nor 'cheesy') that helps you forget you are in Pittsburgh for the hour or so you are there.  The generally laid back, open/airy atmosphere, and spacious seating arrangements make this a decent place to dine with children as well.  Having been there on several occasions, I find the staff to be consistently upbeat (regardless of how hectic it gets), attentive, and well versed on the menu.  My personal favorites: Sun-Drenched Portobello & Vegetable Sandwich (grilled seasonal veggies, tomato, crisp asparagus, pepper-jack cheese in hot-pressed on Cuban bread), Bahamarita, and their homemade Key Lime pie.

LU_F5eSDOg2JAPUW0NtCAw.text: Not bad at all for a chain restaurant. The theme is well executed and feels very authentic. The setting is casual and relaxed, but with enough ambient noise to make it kid friendly. Cuisine includes lots of chicken and seafood options. A "lighter serving" option is available for many meals, making for a cheaper - but still quite filling - meal. I didn't have high hopes going into this place, but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and level of service. I'd definitely eat here again.

G8Jk762uAEpg22LETniGOQ.text: Terrible. Chain restaurant at its lowest.   We ordered the coconut shrimp as an app. It was at our table in literally 90 seconds. While I get that it is nice for the food to be there fast, there is NO WAY that it was an order dropped for us, it had to have been a send back or misring as there is no way they could ring the order, fry them, plate them, and run them. The result was the shrimp, which actually tasted ok, were cool from waiting for us to order them.  As for the entrees: the mahi mahi tacos were boring, made with store bought and stale tortillas, and relied on too much crappy salad for the small sliver of fish. The cuban sandwich was even worse, the meat was dry and rubbery.  The coconut shrimp were okay though and would have been good if they were hot, and the tomato salad was tasty. Everything else was just crap.

he6s_98aMhrbhQwnaKJtOA.text: Why it took me so long to write this review I don't know.  This place as a great set up and is very fun and festive.  The frozen drinks are rocken .

gqA6CoKVG3BCE380FXh8BA.text: Not too bad for a chain place...I've spent quite a bit of time in Jamaica over the years, and the food is "Caribbean" like the Olive Garden is "Italian", but if you keep that in mind, it's a pretty decent dining experience.  Conch fritters were long on fritter and short on conch, but tasty nonetheless.  Coconut shrimp tacos were actually quite good - a nice combination of sweet coconut shrimp and a tangy sauce with jicama slaw.  The menu was a little too long and daunting, and service was just ok - refills were a little difficult to come by.  For lunch with a gift card, I was quite pleased, but if I had saved this for a treat date night, I'd probably be a tad disappointed.

m7h44hYeEoCworcgillmNg.text: Really love this place. I am giving two stars simply because the got rid of the buttermilk chicken sliders. Why would they do this? But they kept other crap on the menu?  Food is good so is service. However if you like the sliders don't come back. I will question if I ever do.

FQbT1jxvHwnQexEXNwsW3A.text: Great food. Hard decision what to get, and even though our server was only "4 days in" he steered us in the right direction. Thanks Thomas!!!!! Nice atmosphere, music, food, and drinks.

YqJHGbEEQz9-LyUOKof6Cg.text: What a delightful dinner experience at the Bahama breeze. I like the fact that they have full meals and a lighter option.

wb7tshudUDiRhBlq7gQEWg.text: Love these places.  They are starting to replace Olive Garden as my go-to chain restaurant when traveling.  They have some nice lighter portions, and their food is very good and reasonably price. Most of their restaurants have someplace you can sit and hear yourself think.  This location is no exception.  I was very pleased with my appetizer (lump crab meat stack with avocado, shrimp, greens, and a very tangy sauce.)  My chicken main dish (a nice, right-sized, tasty platter for ONLY TEN BUCKS) was a very pleasant surprise.  The waitress was efficient and friendly.  General comment to BB management: I really mourn the loss of the corn fritters, they were out of this world.

Pmuzmw2C66dKm3E1t9IfyQ.text: Let me first say that Bahama Breeze is where we go when we want to treat ourselves to a good dining experience and don't mind paying a bit more for quality.  We even call it the "vacation restaurant."   However my visit on Saturday Jan 2, did not live up to our expectations.  It was busy and they were backed up, which was understandable as apparently the entire population of the city decided they needed to shop that day.  But once we were finally seated, the experience did not really improve.  The servers seemed to have no sense of urgency or hustle. Drinks weren't refilled promptly, or at all.  Appetizer was delivered literally 5 seconds before the entrees. I hate that, and mentioned it to the people that brought the food, they just said "sorry and ran away. My actual server was conspicuously absent for most of the meal after that,  No one followed up,  I could see people stacked up in the waiting area, but for most of the meal there were empty tables around us. So either the servers couldn't handle a full house or the kitchen was fouled up.  Either way, the staff I interacted with did not seem to see or care about the problems I saw.   Both adults ordered soup, one bowl was delivered before the entree, another was delivered with the entree. No reason was given, apparently that is a decision that is not made by the patron. I had the black bean soup and fish tacos. The tacos seemed bland, like someone forgot the spice. Really, it was just a hunk of whitefish over coleslaw in a tortilla. The black bean soup was mostly broth, with very little beans.    So I don't know if they were just having a bad day, or if the place is just not as good as it used to be. Disappointing, really.  Wasted someone's holiday gift card that wouldn't normally be able to afford to go there on there own income. That's what really makes me mad.

vkqcWUiahl8CXHAmh2Mo7w.text: We were happily surprised by our experience here. This place has a fun atmosphere, good service, and great food. We had the Shrimp and Lobster Linguini and the Shrimp and Grits, and got the Cocoanut Shrimp as an appetizer. Everything was really nice, and there were so many appealing menu choices.  I was a big fan of the creativity that went into the dishes and all the nice flavors. Really nice service, great portions, lots of shrimp and lobster, and reasonable prices.

Uuw8Yi9lmBesr-c2W8XOxw.text: I used to love Bahama Breeze, but my past couple of visits have forced me to leave a lower rating.  They have changed some of the recipes, and removed the Carribean element to many of their dishes. The flatbreads have become bland pizzas, for example, and several of the seafood dishes have had their fruity sauces replaced with garlic butter generic sauce. The fire pit was also closed down, according to our waiter, and so they do not fire sear their foods anymore. I guess it just broiled.  With those changes, there's nothing special to it anymore and I have not been a customer since. If they reverse those changes i may consider going back and giving a better rating.

KbyNAbGu5sx3zN2aXpVlMQ.text: One of my favorite chain restaurant to eat at. Great service and atmosphere, incredible food and delicious mixed drinks. They can be a little pricy so we don't visit often, but when we do it's always a treat.  My one complaint would be that they seem to change their menu a lot which can be disappointing when you go craving a certain meal only to find that it's gone, but there's always great new food to try so I guess it all evens out. I've definitely never been disappointed trying new things there.

8ul5aGFN3DU2SuzjpbWVtA.text: Order A Chipotle Beef Bowl and I asked for no cheese and sour cream. Waited 15 -20 until they bought out my food made with cheese. So they placed another order and it took about 10-15 to come out and it had Avocados in it. On the menu the dish didn't state it Come with avocado. The second manager didn't apologize nor gave me a discount on my drink . This was my first time here and had an horrible experience. She acted as if messing up people orders twice is normal . I guess it's a Pittsburgh thing. Can't wait to go back to Texas.

6pzQG8RR0OtiKC73PKnGkg.text: My husband and I visited Bahama Breeze in Robinson. They were "out of" margarita mix on National Margarita Day. We decided that was understandable. My husband ordered a Heiniken and I a frozen margarita(that comes in a machine).We then ordered firecracker shrimp - they were "out of it". Becoming frustrated at this point we again started to browse the menu, only to be told..." Let me go double check what we do still have".  At this point we were beyond irritated and asked for our check. The bartender brought it over to us in the amount of $6.66. Now I am surely NOT going to heaven.

H0WKRYMla-OSBGdWYOSDSw.text: This casual and slightly Caribbean-style restaurant has a menu of tacos, shrimp, quesadillas, wings, salads, rice, soups, burgers, chicken, fish, and desserts. One other reviewer here uses the word "passable" to describe this restaurant. I agree. It is not one of my favorite restaurants, but I could eat here occasionally if necessary.

I1ouOaFSy6TUMgl2RENNRw.text: If you want a taste of the Caribbean in your mouth, Bahama Breeze is the place to go. Very friendly staff and a fantastic menu to choose from

Urm6iyddBGtQNjykzObBJQ.text: This chain is part of the Darden Group (Olive Garden, Red Lobster, etc)  Pros:  Great Food (the last 2 times for both my husband and myself)            Atmosphere is very nice and different from the usual PGH fare.            There's a really nice patio/outdoor dining deck that's nice             (depending on the weather), if you can pick up the whole restaurant and plop it down on a beach, it would look totally @ home!    Cons:  Pricey (as most large chains tend to be)             Wait staff is inconsistent.  First Visit:  Fabulous!  Food was great and our server was sooo good that we earned him a "Pineapple"!  (which I will explain later)  Second Visit (7/19/10):  Food was great, service was absolutely awful! We sat outside, which is "seat yourself" and  A.)  it was quite a while before we were acknowledged and drink orders taken. B.)  we were clearly not our waitress'  priority. The food runner ran all of our food and my husband was in need of another drink after the appetizer which went completely un-noticed the duration of the meal.  We looked and looked for ANYone to grab a refill and it was a ghost town on the patio other than the other patrons.  PINEAPPLES:  If you have a great experience with the server assigned to you, if you ask to speak with a manager to tell him/her how awesome your server was, the server "earns a pineapple" for the guest compliment to their service. Its a nice thing to do to show how much you appreciate it when someone does treat you right all night!   :)

PvEc8ZPhygwNiJIBAd8lDg.text: Totally amazing.. me and my wife visited this restaurant  after a long day of shopping at the mall at Robinson .. it was excellent and we enjoyed the food a lot .. we are vegetarians but still we enjoyed this Carre bean sea food friendly restaurant  ... we loved the veggie sandwich and the especially the drinks we ordered . Painkiller I loved it :D

xFZ56_sSOb2ps-ylSs0xkw.text: Bad and overpriced.   Wanted to like this place, convenient location, nice patio outside on a Spring evening, but no. We ordered steak entrees, Oscar and Sirloin, neither was cooked correctly Carly.  Medium fully well done, medium rare was cold and bloody.  Asking for assistance from the waiter got no better results.  We were hungry so we ended up trying to eat what we had but they were so grizzly and tough we gave up.  The fish tacos literally needed to be held up and drained, pouring off some liquid ( wet lettuce?) ruining the crunch a taco should have.  Mashed potatoes were only potatoes side choice, white or sweet.  They had skins on, white mashed potatoes and were not washed!  Periodically, you could feel the crunch of sand/ dirt from potatoes not well scrubbed before cooking.  Yuk!  Ordered wings and quesadilla appetizers early, knowing the other two in my party would arrive hungry.  Waiter discussed hot or mild wings.  He brought onion rings instead and quickly dropped them off and left.  We ate the quesadilla, caught him later to correct and he said I said "rings". I said No and reminded him, " spicy or mild?" And he said Oh yeah. The weird thing is that he reached to take the rings away.  Usually, they say sorry Ill bring you the correct item, and offer you the other, since it cannot go to anyone else.  We may have eaten a few if he had, given how hungry everyone was, if he had. But no, and it was so late by then we cancelled the wings.  This whole fiasco was $75! $90 with tip.  Will never return, neither should you.

01pZMU9povzIkaYqNYTS8g.text: My parents love Bahama Breeze so if I go out to dinner with them this is usually where we end up. I'm not big on chain restaurants but this one gets my seal of approval! We always do the call ahead seating which is great because usually the wait is 45+ minutes around dinnertime on a weekend night.  My mother has a shellfish allergy so when with them we usually start off with the chicken tostones-very similar to nachos except instead of chips, it's fried plantains. Very tasty! When not dining with my parents, I like to start with one of the shrimp apps. Personally, the coconut shrimp is my favorite (and I'm not a fan of coconut except on shrimp). I also like the skillet simmered shrimp which comes with bread to sop up the juices. The firecracker shrimp comes with a spicy red pepper sauce and is good as well. For entrees, I almost always order the wood-grilled tilapia off of the fresh fish menu, mango glazed with grilled pineapple salsa. It's delicious! My parents usually do the same style but with salmon. Also the key west fish tacos are a good  choice. As for drinks, I always,always order a frozen bahamarita (tequila, and kiwi,strawberry,and mango ices). My favorite reason for coming here,believe it or not, is for dessert. I LOVE,LOVE,LOVE the chocolate island and I would seriously come here for just that!  It's rich chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie Island in milk chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise. It is hands down the best dessert I have ever had in a chain restaurant.

m-6BBP61KQ-4lFrx-Mg5eA.text: Meh. Got the shrimp linguine. The servings were large, but nothing had much flavor and it wasn't the best value

adG-8-PU7iIp00i8kxfhsQ.text: Yuca Fries. All I'm sayin!! Ok, not fair. All the the food here is great. Great staff. Awesome atmosphere and ambiance, from decor to Caribbean music. But seriously tho......YUCA FRIES!!

dAGp626hKwvUH4ZXl3kULw.text: Amazing cocktails and appetizers! Can't wait for the main course  UPDATE: Sorry it took long. But the Caribbean food they serve, I would say is good. I would definitely visit them again to checkout the other items

pWBKG9vyVzdCrpKOPJl9ig.text: 1st time here. My boyfriend and I went out for date night and choose this place. Nice atmosphere, very clean. Everything we ate we liked. When the music started it was very loud where we couldn't hear each other. Told manager and they did turn it down a little. I would go back again.

MDg71_nTmFbMFKK3N1oHng.text: After some great visits to this place, this one was a complete bust. I might still be waiting for a server if I didn't grab someone 3 times. Ordered Long Island teas from the bar and not sure what I got. Waitress could not have been more inattentive. Luckily my lobster Mac and cheese with plantains didn't disappoint. I guess I was disappointed because my last visit was so great. I'll be back but they need to fix uneven service problem.

AkkXA8PBTW0_RxKfVMoPOg.text: My wife and I went for lunch on a gift card we got for Christmas.  Probably one of the best chain restaurants in have ate at. Our waitress [Ashley] was extremely nice and helpful. She was busy but prompt with our table and several others around us. My wife ordered a mixed drink and it was delicious, the food was great and portioned well for the cost. We will be visiting here again.

yJ42Vo5mIoj8qP8BeII8gA.text: So a group of 8 went there on Saturday as a get together of retired coworkers. My first time there.!! I had a Bahama Mama cocktail to start along with beef empanadas. They were tasty with the sides and then I had the Pork tenderloin with mashed sweet potatoes and green beans with the fruity Jamican version of salsa. My meal was delicious. I had the coconut cream pie for dessert. Waitress was great for 8 people. We stayed almost 2hrs then were abruptly being asked to leave.

tRHks8-YWt3L_VMBpENFiQ.text: We took our mother out for dinner last night (5-27-2015).  I chose Bahama Breeze at the Robinson Town Center Mall area.  She had never been there in all the years she has lived in Pittsburgh.  My wife also hd never been to a Bahama Breeze.  I am very familiar with the ones in Orlando Florida.  Mom had the Jerk Chicken and my wife had the Coconut Shrimp. They were amazed .at the great taste and quality of the food.  I had never tried their BBQ ribs.  They were the meatiest ribs I have ever had and delicious. Our mom could not stop raving about the food and beverages.  At 92 she has been round the world and has very specific likes and dislikes.  I must add that we were seated promptly at our reserved time.  The servers were very attentive and well trained.  We all had a great evening.

Lr6Hf-Oqp8AX77i_f78few.text: Not gonna lie - surprised to find how much I enjoyed the jalapeno mojito. The coconut shrimp were on point, and the bartender and service was above my expectation. Not a bad use of your money.

JxXAMA4sN3sKj4DGhmImMw.text: The fresh Almond crusted Red Fish was delicious and light, try it wood grilled! Oh and the conch fritters were a great choice.. Crispy and moist.

_gzSppl1PUj2PYSrJxyo9w.text: Terrible service,  we were told there was a 15 minute wait and then after 30 minutes when I checked back we were sat immediately and everyone else that walked in was sat immediately. No explanation was given. It was poorly run with the waitstaff clearly confused and frantic. Won't be coming back

zbzBoX5FpCQ-t8xpduQCuA.text: I mainly went here because when they were in Phoenix I really enjoyed the experience and seeing they were in Pitt I went for it.  Unfortunately that experience was not to be the same 10 years later.  The decor is the same but the menu is a bit different.  Not sure if they are really keeping up with the times but I ordered what I did the last time I was at a BH.  The service should set the tone but seeing that it was the pre-dinner hour I was totally ignored once my order was put in.  The waitress was preoccupied with the table with employees on break than she was serving the bar.  I was not offered a water while I waited and was only told have a nice day after she gave me the order.  She did not check it for accuracy nor ask me if I needed anything else which I did in the measly amount of salad dressing that came with the order.  Suffice it say the salad was a tad brown on the edges so I ended up throwing most it out less the tomatoes and sliced cucumber.  Anyway, the wings were my favorite back in the day but they definitely lacked any flavor.  To sum it up I would say this was a big thumbs down, sad because I really wanted to come back again before I left.

sNy3VkueysV8TY490j7_Dg.text: This place never disappoints me. I usually get the tropical fruit salad which is a good healthy choice. I changed it up a little and had the salmon with mango glaze, cinnamon sweet potatoes, and greens beans; it was prepared well and very flavorful. I also love how the seating and the ambiance that bahama breeze creates.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seating

w9qNnu5VJZHm1VGGPgOUXw.text: My husband and I honeymooned in the Bahamas over the holidays and we fell in love with conch fritters. I came home and told everyone how much I loved them and then my aunt sent me a gift card to Bahama Breeze as a wedding present. This place is so good. Like, unexpectedly really really good. And obviously a lot of people know this because the 2 times we've been there for dinner it was super crowded and there was a 45-minute wait. As we were waiting, a manager called out for a party of 2 with a reservation. I never would have thought to make a reservation here but now I know for next time!  Bahama Breeze is very good.  And I got a pina colada that was outstanding!  Whoever the chef is definitely know Carribean food very well.

0YBgKagFrZmLOsg9Dubp-A.text: I am currently at Bahama Breeze, and I've been here for 2 hours and I still haven't gotten my appetizer. To make it worse I asked for water a half hour ago and I still haven't got it.

7nuzKaDAC8ny4W7R_mPYjg.text: I'm sorry but Pittsburgh is too overwhelming for me to brave driving downtown at night.  Well, at least it was last night, so I headed on over to Robinson Town Center Mall,  or whatever it is called.    Not so big on suburban chain places but I was starving.  Compared to where my hotel is, Robinson was the "big city".  For what it was - suburban chain place  - I give it 5 stars.  Had the Pan seared tilapia with rice and green beans. I enjoyed it. Felt pretty healthy too!  After I spend some more time in Pittsburgh I'm sure I will laugh at the night I ate in the 'burbs because I was too scared of the highways to drive to a trendier neighborhood.  But I will always be grateful that this place was accessible and open 'til 11 pm last night.  I don't think I could have handled another dinner of Fritos from the hotel's convenience shop!  P.S. The last time I ate at a Bahama Breeze was when I lived in Orlando.  Bahama Breeze was like going to Disney to dine without having to drive the extra 30 miles.  This was a nice little reminder of what it's like to "feel" the Florida.  Sigh... why did I move away from there again?

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The tin roof

aa80GUglhDAoOE4P4TfQLw.text: Overall great experience!  Came for happy hour and got some half off apps- beef empanadas were particularly good, though it took a little longer for the apps to get out (probably because it was during happy hour).  The dinner food was also very good, the highlight was their shrimp and mahi bowl.  We also shared a banana nut bread supreme dessert which was also good.  Server did an excellent job- was friendly, attentive, and helpful.  Will definitely be back!

Hscpn1IrL2_B3mUVcCco5Q.text: 3 stars because it was comical that our server had the personality of an awkward boy going through puberty. I got the Jamaican jerk sandwhich which was fantastic. We also got the flight of rum and margaritas which was pretty cool  but when I asked the youngest brother from home improvement on what drinks were good he looked like I was asking him if I could kiss him mom confused and a little grossed out. Regardless it was ok I would try it again. Jerk food was good jerk kid serving was not.

bYdOyh3g-0UivrInZuSUvQ.text: Not great, I had a good experience my first time but on my second trip the empanadas were bland and the Mahi in my fish taco , wasn't even close to being done cooking... I mean completely raw and just sauteed. They comped the meal and gave a free dessert, but I'm pretty sure they messed up the check , either way I'll never be here again. Shame, I like the vacation atmosphere

3NHSSl64Dlodn4vPzhSqbA.text: We arrived for a 4:30p reservation through Open Table. Our appetizers arrived at 5pm and our meal arrived at 5:20p. Our waitress, Annie, was very kind but said they are very short staffed in the kitchen. We gobbled most of the meal due to a flight at 7:30p and boxed the rest. Notified the manager of our displeasure. Will not return. Then! I was notified by open Table that they cancelled my reservation at 5:30pm! This is not right.

cR7HDF3-iMtDkCSj5tRNfQ.text: Came here on valentines day. :) I loved it. Great food and decent drinks. Spinach dip could have been a little better, but everything else was to die for.
